directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.
directives.name: deprecated

directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.
directives.name: include

directives.description:
The @oneOf built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate an Input Object is a OneOf Input Object.

A OneOf Input Object is a special variant of Input Object where exactly one field must be set and non-null, all others being omitted.
This is useful for representing situations where an input may be one of many different options.
directives.name: oneOf

directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
directives.name: skip

args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
args.name: url

directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
directives.name: specifiedBy

fields.deprecationReason: Check `locations` field for enum value FIELD
fields.name: onField

fields.deprecationReason: Check `locations` field for enum value FRAGMENT_SPREAD
fields.name: onFragment

fields.deprecationReason: Check `locations` field for enum value OPERATION
fields.name: onOperation

types.description: Represents scalars, interfaces, object types, unions, enums in the system
types.name: __Type

fields.description: Last time the key was used
fields.name: lastUsedAt

types.description: Artwork URLs for a media item
types.name: Artwork

types.description: An item in the continue watching rail
types.name: ContinueWatchingItem

types.description: Result of creating an API key

fields.description: The plain API key (shown only once)
fields.name: key

types.name: CreateApiKeyResult

types.description:
The `Date` scalar type represents a date. The Date appears in a JSON
response as an ISO8601 formatted string, without a time component.
types.name: Date

types.description:
The `DateTime` scalar type represents a date and time in the UTC
timezone. The DateTime appears in a JSON response as an ISO8601 formatted
string, including UTC timezone ("Z"). The parsed date and time string will
be converted to UTC if there is an offset.
types.name: DateTime

fields.description: Whether this episode has at least one file
fields.name: hasFile

fields.description: Parent TV show info (for context when showing episodes)
fields.name: show

types.description:
The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional
values as specified by
[IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_754).
types.name: Float

types.description:
The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to
refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON
response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer
(such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.
types.name: ID

types.description:
The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric
values. It is NOT compliant with the GraphQl spec, it can represent
values between `-(2^53 - 1)` and `2^53 - 1` as specified by
[IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_754).
It is kept here for backwards compatibility, prefer using
the SpecCompliantInt.
types.name: Int

types.description: A library path for organizing media

fields.description: Whether this path is actively monitored
fields.name: monitored

fields.description: Type of content in this library
fields.name: type

types.name: LibraryPath

fields.description: Whether this file can be direct played (no transcoding needed)
fields.name: directPlaySupported

types.name: MediaToken

fields.name: isFavorite

fields.description: Mark all episodes in a season as watched
fields.name: markSeasonWatched

fields.description: Refresh a media access token before it expires
fields.name: refreshMediaToken

fields.description: Toggle favorite status for a media item
fields.name: toggleFavorite

fields.description: Update playback progress for an episode
fields.name: updateEpisodeProgress

fields.description: Update playback progress for a movie
fields.name: updateMovieProgress

fields.description: Full path from root to this node
fields.name: ancestors

fields.name: isPlayable

types.name: Node

types.description: User playback progress on a media item or episode
types.name: Progress

fields.description: List all API keys for the current user
fields.name: apiKeys

fields.name: continueWatching

fields.description: Get any node by its global ID
fields.name: node

fields.description: Search across movies and TV shows
fields.name: search

fields.name: seasonEpisodes

fields.name: tvShow

fields.name: tvShows

fields.name: upNext

types.description: An item in the recently added rail
types.name: RecentlyAddedItem

types.description: A season of a TV show
types.name: Season

types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.
types.name: String

fields.description: Subscribe to playback progress updates for a specific content item
fields.name: progressUpdated

fields.description: Whether this item is in user favorites
fields.name: isFavorite

fields.description: Next episode to watch for the current user
fields.name: nextEpisode
